Title: 1. Mary Poppins
description: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

Title: 2. My Fair Lady
description: In 1910s London, snobbish phonetics professor Henry Higgins agrees to a wager that he can make a crude flower girl, Eliza Doolittle, presentable in high society.

Title: 3. Goldfinger
description: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.

Title: 4. A Fistful of Dollars
description: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

Title: 5. A Shot in the Dark
description: Bumbling Inspector Jacques Clouseau falls in love with murder suspect Maria Gambrelli and tries to clear her name.

Title: 6. Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
description: A mentally unstable American general orders a hydrogen bomb attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to global nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

Title: 7. Hey There, It's Yogi Bear
description: In the end, Ranger Smith on the helicopter take Yogi, Boo Boo and Cindy home from the tallest building.

Title: 8. A Hard Day's Night
description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Sir Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live TV performance.

Title: 9. I Am Cuba
description: Four vignettes about the lives of the Cuban people set during the pre-revolutionary era.

Title: 10. Becket
description: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

Title: 11. The Umbrellas of Cherbourg
description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

Title: 12. Band of Outsiders
description: Two crooks with a fondness for old Hollywood B-movies convince a languages student to help them commit a robbery.

Title: 13. That Man from Rio
description: A young private on military leave comes to the rescue of his girlfriend who's been abducted by thieves and brought to Rio de Janeiro. An extravagant adventure ensues.

Title: 14. Nothing But a Man
description: A black man and his school-teacher wife face discriminatory challenges in 1960s America.

Title: 15. Marriage Italian Style
description: Wealthy businessman Domenico and penniless prostitute Filumena share a large part of their lives in post-WWII Italy.

Title: 16. Black God, White Devil
description: After killing his employer when he tries to cheat him out of his payment, a man becomes an outlaw and starts following a self-proclaimed saint.

Title: 17. The Soft Skin
description: Pierre Lachenay is a well-known publisher and lecturer, married with Franca and father of Sabine, around 10. He meets an air hostess, Nicole. They start a love affair, which Pierre is hiding, but he cannot stand staying away from her.

Title: 18. Girl with Green Eyes
description: In 1960s Dublin a young girl becomes involved with an older man, a much-travelled and still-married landowner.

Title: 19. Zulu
description: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

Title: 20. Kiss Me, Stupid
description: Jealous piano teacher Orville Spooner sends his beautiful wife Zelda away for the night while he tries to sell a song to famous nightclub singer Dino, who is stranded in town.

Title: 21. Marnie
description: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

Title: 22. Send Me No Flowers
description: When a hypochondriac believes he is dying, he makes plans for his wife--which she discovers and misunderstands.

Title: 23. Goodbye Charlie
description: Womanizing Charlie is shot by an angry husband and falls into the sea. He arrives home after his memorial as a cute woman suffering from amnesia, and his old friend helps him/her.

Title: 24. Night Train to Paris
description: Ex-OSS agent Holiday gets a wartime friend's request to deliver a secret tape in Paris. After the friend is killed, Holiday poses as a photographer's assistant, traveling with models as cover.

Title: 25. The Train
description: In 1944, a German colonel loads a train with French art treasures to send to Germany. The Resistance must stop it without damaging the cargo.

Title: 26. Fail Safe
description: A technical malfunction sends American bombers to Moscow to deliver a nuclear attack. Can all-out war be averted?

Title: 27. What a Way to Go!
description: Four-time widow Louisa May Foster sees a psychologist to discuss her marriages, in which her husbands (humble businessman Edgar, blase millionaire Rod, bohemian painter Larry, and nightclub singer Pinky) got rich and died because of greed.

Title: 28. The Night of the Iguana
description: An ostracized Episcopal clergyman leads a busload of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

Title: 29. Zorba the Greek
description: A reserved English writer travelling to Crete on a matter of business finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

Title: 30. Onibaba
description: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

Title: 31. Woman in the Dunes
description: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

Title: 32. The Fall of the Roman Empire
description: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which the deceased emperor's son, Commodus, demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

Title: 33. Kwaidan
description: A collection of four Japanese folk tales with supernatural themes.

Title: 34. Viva Las Vegas
description: A race-car driver preparing for the Grand Prix wiles his time in Las Vegas working as a waiter to pay for his new engine and soon strikes up a romance with a beautiful young woman.

Title: 35. The Masque of the Red Death
description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

Title: 36. Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
description: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness after the arrival of a lost relative.

Title: 37. Father Goose
description: During World War II, a man persuaded to live on an isolated island and spot aircraft finds himself responsible for a teacher and several students, all female.

Title: 38. Seven Days in May
description: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

Title: 39. Blood and Black Lace
description: A masked, shadowy killer brutally murders the models of a scandalous fashion house in Rome.

Title: 40. The Pawnbroker
description: A Jewish pawnbroker, victim of Nazi persecution, loses all faith in his fellow man until he realizes too late the tragedy of his actions.

Title: 41. Lilith
description: A war veteran gets work at a mental institution, where he meets the beautiful and eccentric Lilith.

Title: 42. The Last Man on Earth
description: When a disease turns all of humanity into the living dead, the last man on earth becomes a reluctant vampire hunter.

Title: 43. The Killers
description: Surprised that their contract victim didn't try to run away from them, two professional hit men try to find out who hired them and why.

Title: 44. The Gospel According to St. Matthew
description: The life of Jesus Christ according to the Gospel of Matthew. Film shows Christ as a Marxist avant-la-lettre and therefore uses half of the text of Matthew.

Title: 45. Carry on Cleo
description: Two Britons, Hengist and Horsa, are captured and enslaved by invading Romans and taken to Rome. One of their first encounters in Rome leaves Hengist being mistaken for a fighter, and gets drafted into the Royal Guard to protect Caesar.

Title: 46. Red Desert
description: In an industrial area, unstable Giuliana attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

Title: 47. The Naked Kiss
description: A former prostitute relocates to a buttoned-down suburb, determined to fit in with mainstream society. But perverse secrets simmer beneath the wholesome surface.

Title: 48. The Americanization of Emily
description: An American Naval Officer's talent for living the good life in wartime is challenged when he falls in love and is sent on a dangerous mission.

Title: 49. The Incredible Mr. Limpet
description: A meek book keeper with an obsession for fish has his world turned upside down, when he is transformed into one, himself and helps the American Convoy save the country, during the war in the 1940's.

Title: 50. Youngblood Hawke
description: Arthur Hawke, a coal truck driver, sells his first novel, moves to NYC, and faces fame, publishing, and a secret affair. Unaware of his feelings for his editor, he soon learns his success depends on his latest book.

Title: 51. The Unsinkable Molly Brown
description: A poor, uneducated mountain girl leaves her cabin in search of respect, a wealthy husband, and a better life in this fictionalized biopic of Margaret "Molly" Brown, who survived the 1912 sinking of the RMS Titanic.

Title: 52. 7 Faces of Dr. Lao
description: A mysterious circus comes to a western town bearing wonders and characters that entertain the inhabitants and teach valuable lessons.

Title: 53. Man's Favorite Sport?
description: The author of a best-selling fishing guide is actually extremely inexperienced in the sport, which causes mayhem when he is entered into a competition.

Title: 54. The Moon-Spinners
description: A teenager encounters romance, intrigue and a search for stolen jewels during her visit to the island of Crete.

Title: 55. Paris When It Sizzles
description: The sprightly young assistant of a Hollywood screenwriter helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

Title: 56. Bikini Beach
description: A millionaire newspaper publisher is fed up by the scantily clad teenagers who hang out on the local beach. Meanwhile, the teens go against an uppity young Englishman who challenges them to a drag race.

Title: 57. First Men in the Moon
description: When a spaceship lands on the moon, it is hailed as a new accomplishment, before it becomes clear that a Victorian party completed the journey in 1899, leading investigators to that mission's last survivor.

Title: 58. The Carpetbaggers
description: Jonas Cord is a disagreeable young tycoon who's building planes, directing films, and catting around on the corporate make in 1930s Hollywood.

Title: 59. The Night Walker
description: A lawyer advises a blind man's rich widow tormented by nightmares.

Title: 60. Good Neighbor Sam
description: To help his divorced neighbor claim a substantial inheritance, the married man next door poses as her husband. The ruse spills over into his advertising job and his recent promotion depends on maintaining a conservative, moral appearance.

Title: 61. Topkapi
description: A conman gets mixed up with a group of thieves who plan to rob an Istanbul museum to steal a jewelled dagger.

Title: 62. Russ Meyer's Lorna
description: The unsatisfied wife of a salt miner experiences a sexual awakening after she is raped by, and subsequently falls in lust with, an escaped convict.

Title: 63. 633 Squadron
description: A RAF squadron is assigned to knock out a German rocket fuel factory in Norway. The factory supplies fuel for the Nazi effort to launch rockets on England during D-Day.

Title: 64. The Gorgon
description: In the early twentieth century, a Gorgon takes human form and terrorizes a small European village by turning its citizens to stone.

Title: 65. Two Thousand Maniacs!
description: Six people are lured into a small Deep South town for a Centennial celebration where the residents proceed to kill them one by one as revenge for the town's destruction during the Civil War.

Title: 66. Fantomas
description: The best men of France - a brave journalist and an extremely energetic commissioner - attack the trail of a mysterious criminal mastermind.

Title: 67. Robin and the 7 Hoods
description: In Prohibition-era Chicago, two rival gangs compete for control of the city's rackets.

Title: 68. Kiss Me Quick!
description: Sterilox, asexual ambassador from a distant planet, comes down to earth in search of feminine breeding stock. A mad scientist treats the alien to dancing sex robots.

Title: 69. Castle of Blood
description: A journalist takes a bet that he can spend the night in a haunted castle on All Hallow's Eve. During his stay, he bears witness to the castle's gruesome past coming to life before him, and falls in love with a beautiful female ghost.

Title: 70. Strait-Jacket
description: After a 20-year asylum stay for a double ax murder, suspicion arises about Lucy Harbin's behavior as she returns to her daughter Carol, who is engaged to marry Michael Fields. Soon, heads begin to roll again. Is Lucy repeating her past?

Title: 71. The Pleasure Seekers
description: Three American lovelies rooming together in Madrid all manage to get themselves into seemingly-unhappy relationships with fellows.

Title: 72. The Black Torment
description: A lord returns to his manor with his new wife, to hear rumors that he had already secretly returned and had committed several murders. Has he lost his mind, or is something dark afoot?

Title: 73. The Long Ships
description: A vagabond Viking adventurer and a Moor both compete to find "The Mother of All Voices", a legendary golden bell near the Pillars of Hercules.

Title: 74. This Special Friendship
description: A tale of the tender relationship between a twelve-year-old boy and the upperclassman who is the object of his desire. All set in the rigid atmosphere of a Jesuit-run school.

Title: 75. Cheyenne Autumn
description: The Cheyenne, tired of broken U.S. government promises, head for their ancestral lands but a sympathetic cavalry officer is tasked to bring them back to their reservation.

Title: 76. The Flesh Eaters
description: A group of young adults trapped on a desert island find the water inhabited by a violent form of flesh-eating organisms.

Title: 77. The Time Travelers
description: In 1964, a group of scientists create a portal that takes them to a barren, mutant inhabited, Earth in the year 2071.

Title: 78. The Third Secret
description: The first secret is what we don't tell people, the second secret is what we don't tell ourselves, and the third secret is the truth. The death of a psychologist is investigated by his teenage daughter and a former patient.

Title: 79. Ghidorah: The Three-Headed Monster
description: A detective protects a princess who prophecies Earth's destruction by a powerful space monster; the world's only hope being if Mothra can persuade Godzilla and Rodan to unite and save the planet.

Title: 80. Mothra vs. Godzilla
description: When greedy tycoons refuse to return Mothra's egg to the people of Infant Island, they must decide if they are willing to answer Japan's own pleas for help when Godzilla arises near Nagoya.

Title: 81. Diary of a Chambermaid
description: A sophisticated and self-assured woman from Paris joins a middle-class rural estate as a maid and causes quite a stir among the variously uptight, perverse and violent inhabitants.

Title: 82. Seance on a Wet Afternoon
description: A medium orders her husband to kidnap a child to help her act.

Title: 83. The 7th Dawn
description: Political and personal intrigues surround a group of characters in Malaya, after the close of the Second World War.

Title: 84. Robinson Crusoe on Mars
description: Stranded on Mars with only a monkey as a companion, an astronaut must figure out how to find oxygen, water, and food on the lifeless planet.

Title: 85. The World of Henry Orient
description: A mischievous, adventuresome fourteen-year-old girl and her best friend begin following an eccentric concert pianist around New York City after she develops a crush on him.

Title: 86. Behold a Pale Horse
description: Famous Spanish bandit Artiguez returns to his native Spanish village after 20 years in French exile, but Spanish cop Vinolas sets a trap for him.

Title: 87. Charulata
description: The lonely wife of a newspaper editor falls in love with her visiting cousin-in-law, who shares her love for literature.

Title: 88. Sex and the Single Girl
description: A womanizing reporter for a sleazy tabloid magazine impersonates his hen-pecked neighbor in order to get an expose on renowned psychologist Helen Gurley Brown.

Title: 89. At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul
description: A gravedigger prowls the city in search of a female to bear him a son.

Title: 90. Woman of Straw
description: Tyrannical, but ailing, tycoon Charles Richmond becomes very fond of his attractive Italian nurse, Maria. The nurse, in turn, falls in love with Charles' ne'er-do-well nephew Anthony, who plots ways to gain control of his uncle's fortune.

Title: 91. Roustabout
description: After a singer loses his job at a coffee shop, he finds employment at a struggling carnival, but his attempted romance with a teenager leads to friction with her father.

Title: 92. The Chalk Garden
description: An elderly woman hires a governess with a mysterious past to look after her disturbed, spoiled teenage granddaughter, who eventually understands the meaning of self-sacrifice as an example of love and grows into a better person.

Title: 93. Pajama Party
description: Sent to Earth to prepare for an invasion, a Martian scout lands amidst a swim party and tries to convince everyone that he really is who he says.

Title: 94. The Pumpkin Eater
description: Beautiful mother of five Jo leaves the banality of her marriage to second husband Giles to wed her passionate screenwriter lover, Jake Armitage. As her suspicion of Jake's philandering grows, Jo's sanity spirals.

Title: 95. 3 Nuts in Search of a Bolt
description: An out of work Method actor is hired by a male model, an ecdysiast, and a car salesman who live together to save money. They want the actor to listen to their problems and go see a psychiatrist so they can get counseling for cheap. The psychiatrist is intrigued by the split personalities indicated by the three separate sets of problems presented by the actor, and soon producers are climbing out of the woodwork trying to buy the rights to the film, while the actor is having trouble keeping his act together.

Title: 96. The Incredibly Strange Creatures Who Stopped Living and Became Mixed-Up Zombies!!?
description: Jerry falls in love with a stripper he meets at a carnival. Little does he know that she is the sister of a gypsy fortune teller whose predictions he had scoffed at earlier. The gypsy turns him into a zombie and he goes on a killing spree.

Title: 97. Santa Claus Conquers the Martians
description: The Martians kidnap Santa Claus because there is nobody on Mars to give their children presents.

Title: 98. The Yellow Rolls-Royce
description: Anthology movie about three owners of a yellow Rolls-Royce: a British diplomat buys the car for his French wife; a mobster's girlfriend has an affair in Italy; an American woman drives a Yugoslavian partisan.

Title: 99. The Horror of Party Beach
description: Sea creatures created from radioactive sludge terrorize a beach community.

Title: 100. Murder Most Foul
description: When Miss Jane Marple joins a theatrical company after a blackmailer is murdered, several members of the troupe are also dispatched by this mysterious killer.

Title: 101. The Evil of Frankenstein
description: Upon returning to his home village to continue his experimental research, the destitute Dr. Frankenstein revives his old creature, but a hypnotist wants the monster to control for himself.

Title: 102. Minnesota Clay
description: Wrongfully imprisoned for a crime he did not commit, Minnesota Clay seeks revenge on the man who withheld evidence at his trial. The catch: he is going blind.

Title: 103. Muscle Beach Party
description: Local beach-goers find that their beach has been taken over by a businessman training a stable of body builders.

Title: 104. Joy House
description: A petty criminal seeks refuge in a house owned by two wealthy American women.

Title: 105. 36 Hours
description: Germans kidnap an American Major and try to convince him that World War II is over so they can get details about the Allied invasion of Europe out of him.

Title: 106. McHale's Navy
description: The crazy crew of McHale decide to use their PT boat as an off-track betting parlor and run in to lots of trouble when they owe money to some marines and a horse they bought causes a Japanese sub to run aground.

Title: 107. The Long Hair of Death
description: A woman under suspicion of witchcraft is burned alive. Her curse brings her back from the dead for revenge.

Title: 108. Bedtime Story
description: Two scam artists preying on women for their money clash in a Mediterranean hot spot. Will the cultured, high-class con artist come out on top, or will the rough small-change scammer rise to win the wager?

Title: 109. Rio Conchos
description: A former Confederate officer and a Mexican try to prevent a former Confederate colonel from selling stolen rifles to renegade Apaches in Mexico.

Title: 110. Kissin' Cousins
description: An Army officer returns to the Smoky Mountains to try to convince his kinfolk to allow the Army to build a missile site on their land. Once he gets there, he discovers that he has a look-alike cousin.

Title: 111. Crypt of the Vampire
description: Count Karnstein sends for a doctor to help his sick daughter Laura. Her nurse believes she is possessed by the spirit of a dead ancestor, Carmilla.

Title: 112. Invitation to a Gunfighter
description: In New Mexico, a Confederate veteran returns home to find his fianc√©e married to a Union soldier, his Yankee neighbors rallied against him and his property sold by the local banker who then hires a gunman to kill him.

Title: 113. Pale Flower
description: A gangster gets released from prison and has to cope with the recent shifts of power between the gangs, while taking care of a thrill-seeking young woman, who got in bad company while gambling.

Title: 114. Murder Ahoy
description: After Miss Jane Marple is made a trustee of a merchant marine training vessel, a fellow trustee is poisoned, and ship's officers are later murdered after she comes on board.

Title: 115. The Gendarme of Saint-Tropez
description: Gendarme Ludovic Cruchot is re-assigned to the French Riviera seaside resort town of Saint-Tropez where petty criminals and his own daughter give him a hard time.

Title: 116. The Best Man
description: The two front runners for their party's presidential nomination, one principled and the other ruthless, vie for the former president's endorsement.

Title: 117. Lady in a Cage
description: A woman trapped in a home elevator is terrorized by a group of vicious hoodlums.

Title: 118. Circus World
description: When circus proprietor Matt Masters decides to take his show on a European tour, it is beset by problems, while he searches for Lili, the mother of his adopted daughter, who disappeared years before.

Title: 119. The Leather Boys
description: An immature teenager marries a young biker but becomes disenchanted with the realities of working-class marriage--and her husband's relationship with his best friend.

Title: 120. Fate Is the Hunter
description: An airline executive refuses to believe that pilot error, by his friend, caused a fatal crash and persists in looking for another reason.

Title: 121. The Outrage
description: Travelers in the 1870s Southwest discuss a recent murder trial in which all the principals told differing stories about the events.

Title: 122. The Strangler
description: An overweight lab technician with low self esteem, brought on by his dominant mother, becomes a serial killer of female nurses.

Title: 123. Children of the Damned
description: Six impossibly intelligent children from all over the world with dangerous psychic powers hide in a church in England after the military tries to experiment on them. Besieged, they warn the military to back off before carnage ensues.

Title: 124. Russ Meyer's Fanny Hill
description: Young, pretty and innocent Fanny Hill has lost her parents and must find her way in life amidst the perils of turbulent 18th century London. She is fortunate enough to find rapidly a place as chambermaid of the effusive Mrs. Brown. Mrs. Brown lives in a large house teeming with female "relatives" in n√©glig√©e and with very relaxed manners. She also insists that Fanny meets alone various gentlemen who show an ardent interest in Fanny.

Title: 125. Ang√©lique
description: In the first of the Ang√©lique series, the beautiful feisty teenage heroine becomes entangled in a political assassination plot and is betrothed to a stranger who is twelve years her senior and a reputed sorcerer.

Title: 126. Teenage Strangler
description: A troubled teen with an undeserved criminal past is the suspect when young women start turning up around town dead and marked up with lipstick.

Title: 127. Tintin and the Blue Oranges
description: Tintin, with the help of his dog Mil√∫, Captain Haddock and a group of children, tries to find the whereabouts of professor Tornasol and a Spanish colleague, who have been kidnapped in Spain after finding a solution to world hunger.

Title: 128. The Black Tulip
description: French Revolution-era count leads double life as bandit "Black Tulip," robbing village. Injured, he has brother impersonate him. Brother discovers count's selfish motives, sparking conflict between their principles and truth.

Title: 129. The Secret Invasion
description: In 1943, a group of hardened criminals is pardoned on the condition it accepts a mission to free a captive Italian general from the clutches of the Nazis.

Title: 130. The Winston Affair
description: In WW2, a US lieutenant stationed in India shoots dead a British NCO and admits his crime but his reason for the murder is so bizarre that it puzzles his defense counsel.

Title: 131. Olga's House of Shame
description: After having been run out of New York City's Chinatown, brothel owner Madame Olga moves her ring of prostitutes and criminals to a deserted ore mine and starts over.

Title: 132. Black Like Me
description: Based on the true story of a white reporter who, at the height of the civil-rights movement, temporarily darkened his skin to experience the realities of a Black man's life in the segregated South.

Title: 133. The Thin Red Line
description: In Guadalcanal during World War II, a private and his sergeant clash during the heat of battle with the Japanese.

Title: 134. The Disorderly Orderly
description: Medical student Jerome Littlefield works as an orderly at a private clinic where he creates havoc due to his ineptitude.

Title: 135. Circle of Love
description: A bed-hopping coterie of soldiers, prostitutes, maids, actors, and aristocrats swap lovers amid the opulence of pre-World War I Europe.

Title: 136. Devil Doll
description: An evil hyponotist/ventriloquist plots to gain a heiress' millions.

Title: 137. Before the Revolution
description: Following the death of his friend, an Italian youth grows increasingly closer to his young aunt.

Title: 138. Apache Rifles
description: A young cavalry officer is assigned the job of bringing in a band of Apaches who have been terrorizing the countryside.

Title: 139. Ensign Pulver
description: Life becomes harried after Ensign Pulver's prank. He and the captain are swept overboard during a storm, ending up on a tropical island with a group of shipwrecked nurses, dancing natives, and one very big case of appendicitis.

Title: 140. Skoplje '63
description: "Skoplje '63" is a 1964 Yugoslavian documentary film directed by Veljko Bulajic about the 1963 Skopje earthquake (Skoplje, per film title, is the Serbo-Croatian spelling of Skopje). The filming started three days after the earthquake and lasted for four months. After that, Bulajic spent 12 months editing the footage at Jadran Film studios.

Title: 141. The Earth Dies Screaming
description: In Britain, a group of survivors fights off a deadly alien invasion that uses robots and a poisonous gas to take over the Earth.

Title: 142. Gertrud
description: In the elegant world of artists and musicians, Gertrud ends her marriage to Gustav and takes a lover, the composer Erland Jansson.

Title: 143. Nightmare
description: A young woman is plagued by nightmares of her asylum-patient mother. Upon returning to her family home, the nightmares become real when she sees a strange woman pacing the halls.

Title: 144. Firelight
description: Menacing flying saucers attack the citizens of a town.

Title: 145. The Tomb of Ligeia
description: A man's obsession with his dead wife drives a wedge between him and his new bride.

Title: 146. Kitten with a Whip
description: A rising political star faces scandal and blackmail when the young woman he tries to help turns out to be a juvenile delinquent.

Title: 147. Guns of Diablo
description: Wagon train scout Linc Murdock reminisces about his old feud with rancher Rance Macklin over pretty Maria during the time when Linc worked for the Macklin ranch.

Title: 148. The Patsy
description: An incompetent bellhop is recruited to fill in for a deceased comedian.

Title: 149. Witchcraft
description: When her grave is disturbed by modern-day land developers, a 300-year-old witch is accidentally resurrected and terrorizes an English village.

Title: 150. Gate of Flesh
description: An injured thief on the run finds sanctuary within a brothel of united, ruthless women.

Title: 151. King & Country
description: During World War I, Army Private Arthur James Hamp is accused of desertion during battle. The officer assigned to defend him at his court-martial, Captain Hargreaves, finds out there is more to the case than meets the eye.

Title: 152. Loving Couples
description: Three expectant mothers think back over their sex lives.

Title: 153. Lana, Queen of the Amazons
description: A scientist and his nephew are hosts of Lana, queen of the Amazons. Meanwhile, other white men penetrate the Brazilian jungle, wishing to find and take the legendary Amazons' treasure.

Title: 154. Island of the Blue Dolphins
description: The story of a Native American girl, abandoned on a tiny island, who is protected by a wild dog.

Title: 155. Dear Heart
description: Bubbly, middle-aged Evie Jackson has been single and alone for quite some time. When she attends a postmasters' convention at a New York City hotel, she meets rakish greeting card salesman Harry Mork and falls in love.

Title: 156. Surf Party
description: A young girl travels to California with a couple of friends in order to visit her brother. After they arrive it doesn't take long for them to get into the swing of things and also to attract the attention of the local police sergeant.

Title: 157. Carry on Spying
description: Agent Simpkins and trainees chase STENCH (the Society for the Total Extinction of Non-Conforming Humans) for a stolen chemical formula, using gadgets and disguises to defeat villains The Fat Man, Dr Milchman, and Dr Crow.

Title: 158. The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb
description: British archaeologists and their American investor ship an Egyptian mummy's sarcophagus to London but someone has the amulet to revive the mummy that will then kill all those who disturbed its tomb.

Title: 159. The Girl-Getters
description: In a seaside town, local men pursue summer tourists for casual flings. Their leader, a photographer named Tinker, unexpectedly falls for a wealthy model, realizing the dynamic of exploitation may be reversed.

Title: 160. Sangam
description: Returning home from war after being assumed dead, a pilot weds the woman he has long loved, unaware that she had been planning to marry his best friend.

Title: 161. Inferno
description: The film depicts the extreme jealousy of a hotelier, Marcel (Serge Reggiani, then 42 years old), towards his wife, Odette (Romy Schneider, then 26 years old).

Title: 162. Bullet for a Badman
description: Former Texas Rangers Sam Ward and Logan Keliher become enemies when Sam turns bank robber and Logan marries Sam's ex-wife.

Title: 163. For Those Who Think Young
description: A wealthy young man tries to woo a university student, while her two uncles work to popularize a local club.

Title: 164. Nothing But the Best
description: A young and ambitious businessman hires an unemployed upper-class man to tutor him in the life skills which he thinks are necessary to succeed. When he succeeds, disaster threatens.

Title: 165. Winnetou: The Red Gentleman
description: Forester, a ruthless oil baron, wants to create a war between the native American tribes and the white men. Old Shatterhand, Winnetou and their sidekick Castlepool try to prevent this.

Title: 166. Dosti
description: A series of unfortunate events cause Ramu, a young boy, to lose his parents and his legs. He is befriended by Mohan, a boy with visual impairment, and they team up to survive on the streets.

Title: 167. Lemonade Joe
description: Straight shooting Lemonade Joe cleans up Stetson City, in this musical parody of early Westerns, after shooting the pants off villain Old Pistol. Joe's endorsement of Kolaloka lemonade as the refresher that assures deadly aim, convinces the Arizona sin-town to abstain from alcohol. But Trigger Whiskey maker Duke Badman's brother the devious gunslinger Hogofogo, comes to save his sibling's saloon from Joe's allies, father and daughter temperance revivalists, the Goodmans. Based on famous Czech parody novel from the 1940s and its various stage adaptations.

Title: 168. The Girl and the Echo
description: Movie about a friendship of two children - a girl and a boy during the last day of summer holiday.

Title: 169. Woh Kaun Thi?
description: One stormy night, a doctor offers a ride to a ghostly woman he meets on the side of the road. Later, he discovers his intended bride is identical in appearance to the ghost. Who was she and why does she haunt him?

Title: 170. Love Meetings
description: Director Pasolini traverses Italy in 1963 with camera and microphone interviewing people in public places about sex, marriage and gender roles.

Title: 171. The Visit
description: An unwed pregnant teenager is run out of town and years later she returns there as a rich woman, raising the town's expectations with her generosity, but she's only out for revenge.

Title: 172. The Castle of the Living Dead
description: Count Drago invites entertainers to his castle, but what the people don't know is that Drago mummifies animals and humans.

Title: 173. Ride the Wild Surf
description: Fabian and Shelley Fabares are among the '60s stars surfing their way to paradise along the famous beaches on Hawaii's North Shore.

Title: 174. The Curse of the Living Corpse
description: Relatives gather in an old house for the reading of a will, but the "dead" man comes back to life and starts killing.

Title: 175. Guns at Batasi
description: Anachronistic strict Regimental Sergeant Major Lauderdale (Sir Richard Attenborough), on a remote colonial African army caught in a local coup d'etat, must use his experience to defend those in his care.

Title: 176. Hamlet
description: After the death of the King of Denmark - Hamlet's father - his brother Claudius ascends the throne, who takes his widow Gertrude as his wife. Hamlet meets the ghost of his father and learns that he was killed by Claudius.

Title: 177. The World's Most Beautiful Swindlers
description: Four swindle stories, taking place successively in Tokyo - Japan (Les cinq bienfaiteurs de Fumiko), Amsterdam - The Netherlands (La riviere de diamants), Italie (La feuille de route), and Paris - France (L'homme qui vendit la tour Eiffel).

Title: 178. Greed in the Sun
description: A rough trucker assigns his new truck and its mysterious cargo to his newest employee, only to see it hijacked by one of his experienced drivers. Now, his friends are after him to retrieve the goods. Are 100,000 dollars worth dying for?

Title: 179. Monsieur
description: Left heartbroken by the death of his beloved wife, a rich banker tries to commit suicide. When he learns from his former maid that his wife was unfaithful he fakes his own death and comes back under a new identity

Title: 180. Emil and the Detectives
description: Emil goes to Berlin to see his grandmother with a large amount of money and is offered sweets by a strange man that make him sleep. He wakes up at his stop with no money. It is up to him and a group of children to save the day.

Title: 181. Dr. Sex
description: Three sex researchers discuss their strangest cases.

Title: 182. Three Outlaw Samurai
description: When poor peasants kidnap a magistrate's daughter to coerce him into reducing their unfair taxes, a wandering ronin decides to give them some help.

Title: 183. Frozen Alive
description: A scientist experimenting with suspended animation decides to use himself as a test subject. Before he is frozen, his wife is killed, and he is suspected of her murder.

Title: 184. The Prince and the Nature Girl
description: Mostly edited footage and outtakes from previous Doris Wishman films, and a couple of newly shot scenes to form a new narrative.

Title: 185. The Quick Gun
description: Gunslinger Clint Cooper returns to his hometown to help fight off a raid by his former gang.

Title: 186. Mars na Drinu
description: One Serbian army battery in the First World War, in forced march with no stopping and rest, arrives to Cer Mountain, and, in decisive moment, enters the fight and throws off Austrian troops which penetrated into the country. This is not only the chronicle of the Battle of Cer, but Serbian drama and drama of one nation who made impossible possible during the fight against the empire which wanted to take away their country. This drama is based on credible events and authentic documents.

Title: 187. Let's Rob the Bank
description: A grouchy shopkeeper made an unsuccessful financial investment, and now he is on the verge of bankruptcy. In order to avenge oneself he engages his own family into a plan to rob a next door bank.

Title: 188. Warm Nights and Hot Pleasures
description: Three college friends go off to New York to become Broadway stars and they endure an endless parade of casting couches and frauds in their pursuit of the limelight, which puts more and more strain on their friendships.

Title: 189. Swingers' Paradise
description: A group of (literally) drifting popsters find themselves involved in a grim sand-and-sandals desert movie. They reckon a few song-and-dance numbers would liven things up.

Title: 190. L'insoumis
description: Thomas, French Legion deserter, rescues hostage Dominique from terrorists. Wounded, he kills guard. Dominique funds his escape to France. Caught between Legion and vengeful terrorists.

Title: 191. The Outlaws Is Coming
description: Larry, Moe, and Curly Joe work for an editor at a Boston wildlife conservation magazine. They make such a mess of the pressroom that their publisher gets rid of them by sending them out west to stop the slaughter of buffalo. Upon their arrival they find themselves being sought after by every notorious gunslinger in history, including Wyatt Earp, Wild Bill Hickcock, and Jesse James. Luckily, pistol-packing Annie Oakley, who has fallen in love with the handsome editor, agrees to protect them against the bad guys.

Title: 192. Where Love Has Gone
description: A divorced couple's teen-age daughter stands trial for stabbing her mother's latest lover.

Title: 193. Sommer i Tyrol
description: At a lakeview hotel in Tyrol, Austria, circa 1900, the headwaiter is in love with the hotel owner, but she's in love with a womanizing guest.

Title: 194. To Trap a Spy
description: The pilot for the TV series "The Man From U.N.C.L.E.," re-edited and released to theaters as a feature.

Title: 195. The Misadventures of Merlin Jones
description: Merlin Jones, resident genius at Midvale College, inadvertently gets into a string of scrapes, both in college and with the law-much to the distress of his long-suffering girlfriend and the local district judge.

Title: 196. Of Human Bondage
description: A medical student becomes obsessed with his faithless lover.

Title: 197. Haqeeqat
description: A platoon of Indian soldiers encounters harsh realities while fighting in the Sino-Indian War of 1962.

Title: 198. Night Must Fall
description: A psychotic killer gets in the good graces of his aging invalid employer, and worms his way into the affection of her beautiful daughter, with unpleasant results for all.

Title: 199. Mail Order Bride
description: Elderly Will Lane arranges marriage of wild son of dead friend to tame him.

Title: 200. The Monster of London City
description: Then the spirit of Jack the Ripper seems to be very much alive in 1960s London as a series of brutal slayings by the Monster of London City has Scotland Yard baffled. In a macabre coincidence, a new play about the famous murderer is about to become a major West End hit... and the leading man is rapidly becoming the prime suspect!

Title: 201. Weekend at Dunkirk
description: In June 1940, during the Dunkirk evacuation of Allied troops to England, French sergeant Julien Maillat and his men debate whether to evacuate to Britain or stay and fight the German troops that are closing-in from all directions.

Title: 202. The Dungeon of Harrow
description: An evil, sadistic count lives in a waterfront castle with his insane family members. One day the survivor of a shipwreck washes ashore near the castle and finds himself a captive there.

Title: 203. Tres muchachas de Jalisco
description: When their attractive cousin Elvira starts a relationship with their middle-aged father don Pepe, beautiful sisters Flor and Mar√≠a make plans to prevent the impending marriage.

Title: 204. The Thrill Killers
description: Three psychotic murderers escape from a mental institution and stalk women in Los Angeles.

Title: 205. The Bargee
description: A lock-keeper entrusts his daughter with a canal Casanova, and she soon falls pregnant. He refuses to open his locks until the guilty party confesses.

Title: 206. Black Peter
description: Reality movie of a few days in the life of a Czech teenager when he starts work.

Title: 207. The Donkey Comes on a Tank
description: Sabu was once a boy soldier, but people in his village disliked him. He finally broke loose when his land was taken.

Title: 208. Get Yourself a College Girl
description: A college co-ed tries to balance her time writing songs and dealing with her publisher who tries to pursue her.

Title: 209. A House Is Not a Home
description: Biopic of notorious New York City Madam Polly Adler, set during the Roaring Twenties.

Title: 210. The Shape of Night
description: A woman is pushed into prostitution by her violent yakuza boyfriend.

Title: 211. The Confession
description: Ginger Rogers, owner of a bordello, helps thief Ray Milland locate an ancient buried treasure.

Title: 212. The Brass Bottle
description: An architect buys an antique brass bottle that contains an ancient genie who's determined to fulfill his new master's every wish.

Title: 213. Taggart
description: Kent Taggart's family, with their cattle stampeded, are killed by those who started it. In a fair gunfight, he kills the man's son responsible for it all and when he runs, a warrant is issued and a price put on his head.

Title: 214. A Married Woman
description: A superifical woman finds conflict choosing between her abusive husband and her vain lover.

Title: 215. El camino
description: A boy is separated for the summer from his girlfriend by 100 kilometers' distance.

Title: 216. Carry on Jack
description: A new midshipman joins a frigate, encountering mutiny, pirates, mistaken identities, and shipwrecks while navigating Spanish waters with his captain, lover, and friend. Survival is uncertain in this swashbuckling adventure.

Title: 217. Psyche 59
description: In London, the pregnant wife of an industrialist falls down the stairs, loses her sight and has no recollection of the events but suspects that a mentally traumatic experience prior to the fall caused her accident.

Title: 218. Old Shatterhand
description: Renegades trying to get the army to abandon their fort get the Indians addicted to whiskey, then convince them to attack and drive out the soldiers.

Six youth criminals are chosen to participate in a social experiment, named "Guesthouse Objectivity" (Pensionatet Sakligheten), where they are assigned to live together in an apartment while being supervised by two forgiving social workers.

Title: 220. The Ape Woman
description: A modest Neapolitan man meets a young woman with excessive hairiness. He exhibits her at fairs and marries her. It is after marriage that he receives a tempting offer from a French manager.

Title: 221. Beti Bete
description: A widower with three young children finds himself in debt. Blinded, in an industrial accident, he loses his job and is admitted to hospital. Upon returning home, he overhears the heartless landlord criticising him for not dying instead of "merely" blinding himself because, if he were dead, the children could be looked after in an orphanage. He decides not to enter the house and disappears. Left alone, the children are evicted. They lose contact with one another after one is left on a train and another is kidnapped. Years pass. The children grow up in different homes under different circumstances. But fate has decreed that the family shall not be forever parted.

Title: 222. Sallah Shabati
description: The sharp, often hilarious satire that became the most successful film in Israeli history (until that time) is about new immigrants Sallah and his family, who are left in a shack near their promised apartment and are abandoned for months. A Yemenite Jewish family that was flown to Israel during "Operation Magic Carpet" - a clandestine operation that flew 49,000 Yemenite Jews to Israel the year after the state was formed - is forced to move to a government settlement camp. The patriarch of the family, portrayed by Chaim Topol, tries to make money and get better housing, in a country that can barely provide for its own and is in the midst absorbing hundreds of thousands of Jewish refugees from Arab countries.

Title: 223. The Monster of the Opera
description: A theater troupe rent an old theater which has been closed for years. While busy rehearsing for their next play, an elderly caretaker repeatedly warns them of impending doom if they don't leave immediately.

Title: 224. The Great Spy Chase
description: A cold-war spy parody. After the death of an armaments manufacturer, an international group of spies is drawn into a high-stakes battle of wits to obtain the valuable military patents which have been inherited by the lovely widow.

Title: 225. I'd Rather Be Rich
description: A young heiress is summoned to the bedside of her dying grandfather. The man's last wish is to meet her fiance, but problems arise when the fiance is delayed and a young chemical engineer is persuaded to take his place. When the grandfather suddenly (and secretly) recovers, he uses the situation to his advantage - playing matchmaker in an attempt to ensure his granddaughter's happiness.

Title: 226. The Human Duplicators
description: An alien is dispatched from a faraway galaxy to take over the Earth by duplicating humans and creating a race of zombies. But the alien's heart is softened by the persevering goodness of a beautiful blind woman.

Title: 227. White Slaves of Chinatown
description: Olga uses pot parties and comic-book violence to turn Gigi Darlene and other female captives before putting them to work as drug-addicted hookers.

Title: 228. Contest Girl
description: On a seaside holiday, pretty Bristol typist Shirley meets Dan Mackenzie from her local paper. He persuades her that she has what it takes in the world of beauty contests, and so it proves. Ditching her predictable fianc√© and having to leave home, Shirley moves to London to continuing success. Increasingly smitten by her, Dan reckons he should be more than just her manager, but this is not at all the way Shirley sees things.

Title: 229. Italiano brava gente
description: Chronicle of the unheralded and unsuccessful invasion of the Soviet Union by the Italian army during World War II.

Title: 230. The T.A.M.I. Show
description: Surf pop duo Jan and Dean host this showcase of performances by popular rock and roll and R&B musicians of the era.

Title: 231. The New Interns
description: Sequel to the 1962 film 'The Interns', this medical melodrama details the work of interns, nurses and doctors at a major American hospital.

Title: 232. Dog Star Man
description: An experimental film from Stan Brakhage in which a man and his dog ascend a wooded mountain.

Title: 233. Father of a Soldier
description: An old man goes to visit his wounded son in a hospital, but it turns out that he's already been released and is back on the front lines. Reluctant to return home empty-handed, he tries to follow and find him.

Title: 234. All These Women
description: A critic blackmails a famous musician with his biography filled with the revelations of many of his women.

Title: 235. One Potato, Two Potato
description: In his wanderlust, Joe Cullen moves from the US to South America to work in a mining camp, he leaving behind his wife Julie and their infant daughter, Ellen Mary. After Joe stops writing and sending money, Julie, not expecting Joe ever to return to her in he being dissatisfied with married life, files for divorce, and moves with Ellen Mary to the town of Howard to start life anew working in the payroll department of Howard Factory. Among the people she meets and befriends in Howard is coworker Frank Richards, the friendship with him which slowly but eventually blossoms into romance. Despite some opposition from his parents, especially his father, Frank and Julie get married, Frank, in the process, becoming the only father that Ellen Mary has really ever known, a loving one at that. After Julie and Frank have a child of their own, William so named after his father, Joe, four years after his departure, returns solely wanting to reestablish a relationship of sorts with now adolescent Ellen Mary. After Joe sees Julie's new life, he changes his want from that relationship with Ellen Mary to suing for full custody. The sole issue, originally with William's Sr.'s objection to the marriage, and to Joe's want for full custody, is that Julie and Joe, and thus by association Ellen Mary, are white, while Frank is black.

Title: 236. Agent 8 3/4
description: Czech-speaking, out-of-work Briton Nicholas Whistler (Dirk Bogarde) is unwittingly sent on a secret mission to Prague by British Intelligence.

Title: 237. Panic Button
description: A businessman plans to solve his tax problems by financing a film version of "Romeo and Juliet". He hires Maurice Chevalier and Jayne Mansfield to play the title roles, and Akim Tamiroff to direct. The finished film is shown at the Venice Film Festival, where it's considered a witty parody and awarded a Golden Lion.

Title: 238. One Man's Way
description: Follows the life of a world-famous minister, lecturer and best-selling author.

Title: 239. Hercules and the Tyrants of Babylon
description: Hercules fights to free the people of Babylon from an evil sorceress.

Title: 240. The Mistresses of Dr. Jekyll
description: A mad scientist creates a hideous monster to carry out his murderous plans.

Title: 241. Seduced and Abandoned
description: A desperate Sicilian man, whose 15-year-old daughter was seduced and impregnated by his older daughter's fianc√©, tries to find a way to save the family's honor.

Title: 242. The Young Lovers
description: Eddie wants to live a life without responsibilities. He meets Pam and they fall in love. When Pam gets pregnant, Eddie must face up to the problem.

Title: 243. A Distant Trumpet
description: West Point graduate Lt. Hazard is posted to Fort Delivery, Arizona, where he has to deal with lax discipline, romantic complications, Apaches and his conflicting feelings toward the Indians.

Title: 244. Looking for Love
description: Girl quits singing dream to pursue husband. Works at brokerage hoping to marry coworker. Coworker uses her idea to develop product. She gets singing opportunity, must choose between career and marriage.

Title: 245. Hercules Against the Moon Men
description: Hercules is summoned to oppose the evil Queen Samara, who has allied herself with aliens and is sacrificing her own people in a bid to awaken a moon goddess.

Title: 246. El padrecito
description: A new priest comes to a little town causing discomfort to parishioners.

Title: 247. Day-Dream
description: While under sedation in a dentist's office, a young art student has sex fantasies about naked women, vampires and a beautiful patient he saw in the office.

Title: 248. Revenge
description: After killing a high-ranking officer in an illegal duel, a low-ranking samurai is declared insane and challenged to a fixed duel by the vengeful clan to which his dead opponent belonged to.

Title: 249. Father Came Too!
description: A young married couple experience difficulties doing up a cottage, and are hindered by the wife's father.

Title: 250. Shock Treatment
description: An actor hired to locate $1 million in stolen loot endures the rigors of an insane asylum.

Title: 251. Welcome, or No Trespassing
description: A satirical comedy about the excessive restrictions that children face during their vacation in a Young Pioneer camp.

Title: 252. Olga's Girls
description: Ruthless narcotics dealer and white slavery ring leader Olga keeps her harem of girls in line by hooking them on addictive drugs. Olga suspects an informant in their midst and uses various brutal methods of torture to weed out the squealer. Meanwhile, several of Olga's girls plot their revenge against Olga for her continual sadistic treatment of them.

Title: 253. Your Cheatin' Heart
description: The story of the country and western singer Hank Williams.

Title: 254. The Mysterious Magician
description: The sister of the criminal named "Hexer" is murdered. Scotland Yard Inspector Higgins believes that the criminal will surface to take his revenge and plans to set a trap to finally capture him. However, bodies soon start piling up.

Title: 255. East of Sudan
description: During the Mahdist insurrection in the Anglo-Egyptian Sudan, veteran colonial Private Baker teams up with freshly arrived gentleman Murchison, trying to evacuate from southern Barash the Emir's daughter Asua and her English governess, Miss Woodville. It's a perilous journey on the Nile and its banks. They must face crocodiles, Arab slavers, and a backward Negro tribe they prey on, where King Gondoko's missionary-raised brother Kimrasi saves and joins them. Once in capital Khartum, they find the revolt has reached it and the men join the fight.

Title: 256. Flight from Ashiya
description: A flight crew tries to save the survivors of a shipwreck off the coast of Japan during a raging typhoon.

Title: 257. Kashmir Ki Kali
description: A rich young man woos a proud girl against her father's wishes.

Title: 258. Strange Voyage
description: Go through peculiar visuals and nostalgiac sights as you see a classic couple undergo obstacles like no other.

Title: 259. Dogora
description: An amorphous cellular life-form descends from the atmosphere to consume carbon in the form of diamonds.

Title: 260. Diamonds of the Night
description: Two Jewish boys escape from a train transporting them from one concentration camp to another. The film goes beyond the themes of war and anti-Nazism and concerns itself with man's struggle to preserve human dignity.

Title: 261. Time of Indifference
description: A penniless countess falls in love with a cad, unaware that he is also involved on the side with her beautiful daughter.

Title: 262. Blood on the Arrow
description: In 1871 Arizona, an escaped outlaw survives an Indian attack and helps a trading-post family retrieve their kidnapped son from marauding Apaches.

Title: 263. The Starfighters
description: A young Air Force lieutenant falls in love with fighter planes while his father, a Congressman and war hero, yearns for him to fly heavy bombers.

Title: 264. Ken
description: Kokubu Jiro, stoic Kendo captain, perplexes teammates like arrogant Kagawa who struggles to understand his reserved demeanor.

Title: 265. Sex and the College Girl
description: This early 1960s film depicts the trivial pursuits and relationships of two college-age girls on a weekend vacation to a luxury resort in Puerto Rico.

Title: 266. It Happened Here
description: In 1940, Germany invades Britain and transforms it into a Fascist state where some Britons collaborate and others resist. In 1944, Pauline, an apolitical Irish nurse becomes a reluctant player in the fight between the two sides.

Title: 267. Rattle of a Simple Man
description: When a group of northern soccer fans are down in London for the Cup Final one of their number winds up with a lady of the night. As they talk, the unsophisticated and naive lad starts to believe he has found true love.

Title: 268. The Racetrack Murders
description: (1964) Hansjorg Felmy, Ann Smyrner, Hans Nielson, Walter Rilla. Mystery at the track! A well-known thoroughbred is slain by a rival horse owner. Soon jockeys are being murdered by a mysterious killer. Scandals, blackmail, and drugs abound in this fine Wallace thriller. 16mm.

Title: 269. Rajkumar
description: Prince Bhanu Pratap returns from a decade in a foreign country, together with his friend Kapil. His father, the King (Raja)has married again after Bhanu Pratap's mother passed away, and has a son by his new wife Maharani (Queen) Kalavanti. The Queen's brother Narpat Singh has designs upon the throne and enrolls his sister the Maharani in his plot, by promising to unseat Bhanu Pratap and install her son as the heir. Prince Bhanu Singh has been tipped off, so he starts to behave like a CLOWN prince, instead of acting as the CROWN prince, in an attempt to flush out the schemers. Accused of a murder, the Prince has to flee the Palace, with the police after him. To compound matters, the daughter of the murdered man is committed to exacting revenge, by killing the killer. Going incognito, Bharat Pratap emerges as Bharat Ram, and displays his true character. Can Princess Sangeeta (Sadhna) forgive Rajkumar who she believes killed her father? How can she reconcile her love for Bharat Ram, the common man, with her hatred for the Royal Bhanu Singh-alleged murderer of her father? This is a complex story of Royalty in India, in the post Independence (from the British) era, before democracy took root. It is a story of love, Indian values and to some extent superstitions and the conflict between values, superstition and modern views of the world they lived in.

Title: 270. Server Sundaram
description: A poor waiter falls for a rich woman. With the help of his best friend, he becomes a successful film actor. But he is unaware that his friend and his ladylove love each other.

Title: 271. Wolves, Pigs and People
description: A lonely gangster tries recruiting men to plunder a respected and powerful gang.

Title: 272. Shadow of Evil
description: An American agent is killed in Bangkok while investigating suspicious virus outbreaks in south east Asia. Agent OSS 117 is sent to Thailand to unravel the mysteries behind the man called Dr. Sinn.

Title: 273. The Monster of Camp Sunshine or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Nature
description: A scientist carelessly dumps some toxic waste into a river. The gardener at a nudist camp drinks the water, turns into a monster and attacks all the (female) nudists.

Title: 274. A Tiger Walks
description: A tiger escapes from a circus truck as it passes by a small town, and hides itself in the surrounding woods. This throws the town into a panic and everyone wants the animal killed immediately, except for the daughter of the sheriff. She wants to capture the tiger and put it in a zoo, thereby saving the tiger's life. Her determination starts a nationwide campaign among children to raise the money to buy the tiger from the circus, but first, she, her father and an Indian tiger trainer must find the tiger before the National Guard do, who have orders to kill it on sight.

Title: 275. Night of the Vampires
description: A mad scientist and his bevy of vampires terrorize a German village. A detective and a witch set out to stop them.

Title: 276. Gli schiavi pi√π forti del mondo
description: Tribune Marcus Aulus, out of favor in Rome because of his alleged sympathy for Christians, arrives to take charge of an aqueduct project on the hot, arid fringes of the Empire. Centurion Gaius, cruel and corrupt, resents being replaced by Marcus. He instigates a revolt by his slave-workers, then blames the situation on Marcus. During the revolt, five muscular slaves escape. They meet up with fellow escapee Balisten, a farmer unjustly condemned to the aqueduct project. Balisten, impressed by Marcus's enlightened attitudes, has rescued the Tribune from the revolt. The six slaves, with Marcus's advice, plan to gain their freedom using their prowess as gladiators. Marcus plans to clear his name and to re-unite with his fianc√©e, Claudia, recently arrived from Rome. Gaius plans to kill Marcus and thus hide the truth about the slave revolt. Brawls and fights both inside and outside the arena come thick and fast.

Title: 277. Smokescreen
description: A fastidious insurance assessor investigates a potential case of insurance fraud in Brighton and uncovers a murder.

Title: 278. The Golden Cockerel
description: A poor, but very lucky man in the cock fighting, is hired by a rich man, but both are in love with the same woman

Title: 279. Crooks in Cloisters
description: After a minor train heist, Little Walter and his gang of six flee London, setting up shop in an abandoned Cornish monastery. Despite their criminal past, the group gradually adapts to the peaceful monastic lifestyle.

Title: 280. Ya shagayu po Moskve
description: Young Siberian writer Volodya meets Kolya in the Moscow metro in his visit to a famous author. Volodya and Kolya's friend Sasha adventure their love interests in their own way, while Kolya sets out to help them.

Title: 281. The Death Ray of Dr. Mabuse
description: The evil Dr. Mabuse develops a death ray with which he threatens the world.

Title: 282. Signpost to Murder
description: An escapee from an asylum takes refuge in a woman's house; but she has dark secrets of her own.

Title: 283. Aap Ki Parchhaiyan
description: A family drama with a special focus on two generations of the Chopra family. Dinanath Chopra lives in a small tenement with his wife, and two sons Baldev, and Chandramohan. Dinanath re-finances his house in order to get Baldev to study further and be a doctor, and also gets him married with Rekha who comes from a very wealthy family. Chandramohan studies in college, and has a sweetheart in the form of the gorgeous Asha. Asha lives with her mom, and dad, a sort of quack. Differences in the Baldev emerge and multiply. Baldev and Rekha move to their palatial house. The birth of a baby boy to Rekha does lighten things up a bit, but not for long. Dinanath loses his eyesight in an accident and becomes blind. Chandramohan goes out of town to look for employment, leaving his sick mother and blind father at the mercy of an uncaring daughter-in-law, and eventually the older couple are forced to leave Baldev's house. Chandramohan returns and is unable to locate them. What will be the fate of his parents in an unfriendly, cold, and heartless city?

Title: 284. Room 13
description: A serial-killer is murdering the ladies of a night club. Detective Gray is seeking for the killer but can only find a lot of gangsters. And the killer is about to act again...

Title: 285. Anthar l'invincibile
description: The son of Hercules is pitted against a ruthless desert warrior.

Title: 286. Mozambique
description: An out-of-work and penniless American pilot is offered work in Mozambique and promptly becomes an unwitting pawn in a world of drug smuggling, kidnap and murder.

Title: 287. Dingaka
description: A film about an African tribesman seeking revenge against the people who murdered his daughter. His crusade leads him to commit murder himself, and to trial before a court.

Title: 288. This Is My Street
description: In this British kitchen-sink style drama, a bored housewife (June Ritchie) living in a run-down inner city London house begins an affair with her mother's lodger (Ian Hendry), who lives next door.

Title: 289. Hamlet
description: The highly successful 1964 Richard Burton Broadway production of "Hamlet", deliberately staged in the style of a "dress rehearsal", but performed in front of a live audience.

Title: 290. Nudes on Tiger Reef
description: A Broadway director goes to a Florida nudist camp for a rest. He's shocked to discover that the star of his Broadway show is also a nudist and he decides to make a movie there with her.

Title: 291. Advance to the Rear
description: When A Union Army outfit of misfits and rejects is sent to the Western territory, Southern spies try to figure out what they're doing there.

Title: 292. Los novios de mis hijas
description: Una viuda, su ahijado y sus cuatro hijas se ver√°n envueltos en un drama familiar, en el que tambi√©n se involucrar√°n los j√≥venes que las cortejan.

Title: 293. Pyro... The Thing Without a Face
description: A married man has a brief affair, then goes back to his wife and children. His jilted mistress, believing that if he had no more family he'd come back to her, sets fire to his house, hoping to kill them. The man, unsuccessfully trying to rescue them, is horribly burned. After he undergoes an operation to reconstruct his face, he begins to plot his revenge against his former mistress.

Title: 294. Honeymoon Hotel
description: Jay Menlow is jilted at the altar by his fianc√©e, Cynthia Hampton. His pal, Ross Kingsley, persuades him to use his reserved-in-advance accommodations at the Boca Roca Hotel (honeymooners only) in lieu of the doomed honeymoon. Ross will accompany him to bolster him up and Cynthia will soon beg to have him back. Ross' gesture is not quite as altruistic as it appears. He has been fooling around with Sherry Nugent, his employer Mr. Sampson's girlfriend, and figures that a brief exodus from New York and his boss is in his own best interest. However, Mr. Sampson shows up followed by his ever loving wife who has decided to find out just what goes on on her husband "business" trips. Complications, including schemes to avoid the hotel's "no bachelors allowed" rule also follow.

Title: 295. Back Door to Hell
description: During World War II, a three man commando team places its trust in the hands of a band of Filipino resistants, as they try to knock out a Japanese communication center.

Title: 296. The Mystery of Thug Island
description: Three year old Ada, daughter of the British captain McPherson, is captured by the Indian Tukh sect to represent the incarnation of Kali. Ever hidden in a vast underground system of caverns, she watches over human sacrifices, doubting her vocation. 15 years have passed when her father finally finds her and attempts a rescue, together with a snake-hunter who has fallen in love with her. A battle ensues.

Title: 297. Ring of Treason
description: During the Cold War, a RN warrant officer stationed in the British Embassy in Warsaw leaks secrets to his Polish girlfriend who's a Soviet agent and after his transfer to a naval station in Britain he joins a Soviet spy ring.

Title: 298. Yearning
description: After a bombing raid destroys the family store and her husband, Reiko rebuilds and runs the shop out of love stopped short by destruction.

Title: 299. Empire
description: A single shot of the Empire State Building from early evening until nearly 3 am the next day.

Title: 300. Sin in the Suburbs
description: Several unhappy suburban housewives partake in numerous affairs. One of them gets the neighbors to join her and her fake brother's secret sex club. Meanwhile, the prudish closeted daughter of one of the women starts an affair with her.

Title: 301. The Lively Set
description: Casey Owens (James Darren), a young mechanic, has developed a design for a turbine car engine, paving the way for a jet-powered auto certain to set a new land speed record. Wealthy playboy Stanford Rogers (Peter Mann) hires Casey to build a car for him to attempt to set a new Land Speed Record. Chuck Manning (Doug McClure), an engineering student Casey met in a drag race, discovers potential flaws in the car's design. After an unsuccessful test run, Rogers abandons the turbine-powered. He decides to turn his attention to race a car in the Tristate Endurance Race. Casey and Chuck buy the wrecked Land Speed car and salvage the Turbine Engine. They fix the Turbine and install it in a car that they enter in the Tristate Endurance Race. Pamela Tiffin plays Eadie, Chuck's sister, who becomes Casey's love interest.

Title: 302. Prawo i piesc
description: At the end of World War Two, Polish people move to the western lands vacated by Germans. But some ruthless profiteers pose as government representatives and intend to make off with loot from a deserted town they took over. One honest man stands up against them because he believes these goods belong to the people.

Title: 303. Karnan
description: Karnan, Kunti's first-born son with Surya, is unaware of his ancestry. When Duryodhana, the Kaurava crown prince, goes to war against the Pandavas, Karnan unknowingly fights his own brothers.

Title: 304. Law of the Lawless
description: Hothead Pete Stone has been arrested for the murder of George.

Title: 305. Campe√≥n del barrio (Su √∫ltima canci√≥n)
description: A young man eagerly prepares for triumph as boxer in a neighborhood gym with the firm intention of escaping poverty, being champion and to marry his girlfriend who sings in a nightclub,

Title: 306. The Guns
description: In an extremely poor region in the Northeast of Brazil, a group of soldiers try to stop the population from sacking a food deposit.

Title: 307. Hour of Death
description: Bob Carey, just released from prison, learns that his fiancee Maria has married rich farmer Cifford. But she is mortally ill and Bob agrees to accompany the couple to a surgeon in Laredo, passing through Apache territory and the desert.

Title: 308. The Blood Drinkers
description: A mad nobleman and his vampiric helpers terrify a small town until the villagers turn against them. This intriguing Filipino fright film was shot in an eerie combination of color and sepia tones.

Title: 309. I maniaci
description: Features a series of brief comic shetches based on manias, mainly sexual, featuring several figures of Italian society.

Title: 310. Cruel Gun Story
description: A convict fresh out of prison, with a handicapped sister, is coerced by a wealthy mob boss into organizing an armored racetrack car heist.

Title: 311. Dear John
description: John is a shipmaster on a very small transportation boat which regularly attends a very small harbour to buy food, actually from Anna's father. She is a waitress and has a young daughter. She tells John that her name is Anita. They have met many times, but their first personal meeting is when both are swimming in early morning. John is asked to have morning coffee with Anna's family. He invites her and her child to a trip to Zoo in Copenhagen. Both have genuine feelings for each other. There are lovely three-some scenes when John is proud of "being" a father, and beautiful love scenes. Christina Schollin's naked body is cute but never obtrusive. But at that time girls were depreciated if they "gave in" too soon. So these scenes repeatedly alternate with hot misunderstandings, well-known exactly when two people with genuine feelings fear misunderstandings and try to preclude them. In the last minutes of the movie, when each has left the "harbour village" on the next day, and John has learned the real name of "Anita" and calls her from the boat, both realise without saying anything about it, that this is the beginning of a long relationship based on mutual feelings.

Title: 312. Code 7, Victim 5
description: After a millionaire's valet is murdered, he hires a detective to uncover by whom and why his man was killed.

Title: 313. Ace of Spades
description: An expert card game hustler, a beautiful woman, and their smooth friend try to take advantage of wealthy tourists with their clever schemes.

Title: 314. Sinderella and the Golden Bra
description: When Sinderella's cruel stepmother prevents her from attending the royal ball, she gets some unexpected help from her inebriated fairy godfather.

Title: 315. Goodbye in the Mirror
description: A dramatic feature shot on location in Rome. Centered around the adventures and illusions of three girls living abroad, the film explores their restlessness and personal involvements in assuming the role of woman as hunter.

Title: 316. Malamondo
description: This documentary looks at strange behaviors and practices in Europe, including nude skiing in Switzerland, hog-butchering in Italy, and an orgy in a graveyard.

Title: 317. A Yank in Viet-Nam
description: The film follows a U.S. Marine Corps pilot (Marshall Thompson) who is shot down over the Vietnamese jungle. In his endeavor to get to safety, he meets a female guerrilla fighter (Kieu Chinh) and a nationalist named Hong (played by the Filipino actor Mario Barri).

Title: 318. Samson and the Mighty Challenge
description: Four muscular heroes fight the evil ruler of an oppressed people.

Title: 319. French Dressing
description: A drab little English seaside town tries to improve its image--and increase its revenues--by holding a film festival. When a famous continental star agrees to attend, things get out of hand.

Title: 320. Mutiny in Outer Space
description: A creeping fungus starts killing off astronauts on a trip back from the moon.

Title: 321. Bebo's Girl
description: A country girl becomes involved with a partisan, follows him, and stands by him even when sentenced for crimes.

Title: 322. Sleep
description: A man sleeps for five hours.

Title: 323. The Flying Saucer
description: An exasperated police inspector receives different eyewitness accounts surrounding a downed saucer and its female occupant.

Title: 324. Lullaby of Bareland
description: A husband and wife, seeking to renew the excitement in their relationship, enjoy a weekend away from each other. He spends his time watching a exotic dancer. She goes to a nudist camp and partakes of various nudist activities.

Title: 325. Flipper's New Adventure
description: Boy Sandy and Dolphin Flipper are in the Bahamas where they pester a bunch of outlaws holding an English family captive.

Title: 326. The Magnificent Cuckold
description: Andrea Artusi begins to have doubts about the loyalty of his beautiful wife. When doubt becomes an obsession, his behavior becomes completely crazy, stalking her relentlessly.

Title: 327. War of the Zombies
description: A fantastic yarn about a plot to conquer the world with an army of zombies.

Title: 328. Spartacus and the Ten Gladiators
description: Spartacus And The 10 Gladiators

Title: 329. Backfire!
description: A greedy gold smuggler hires a handsome hero to transport a stolen fortune to a new hideout in this thrilling adventure.

Title: 330. The Devil-Ship Pirates
description: A damaged privateer deserts the Spanish Armada and makes land for repairs near a village on the British coast, terrorizing the local inhabitants.

Title: 331. The Comedy Man
description: Charles Byrd, known as "Chick", has spent his adult life acting in small repertory companies all over the UK, and he's never had much luck. All too aware that he's no longer young, Chick makes one last stab at finding success in London.

Title: 332. Kisses for My President
description: A husband must take on the role of First Lady when his wife becomes the first female US President, navigating women's groups and social events.

Title: 333. Intentions of Murder
description: A housewife living under her tyrannical husband has her life stressfully turned upside down after getting raped by a burglar.

Title: 334. Lost Treasure of the Incas
description: A cowboy goes to help out his friend, who has been falsely accused of murder. The two find themselves in the rugged and mysterious Pallidi Mountains, where they come up against an outlaw gang that is searching for a buried Inca treasure, which is guarded by a lost Inca tribe.

Title: 335. Agent 38-24-36
description: A Russian spy is supposed by the British Secret Service to steal some faked orders, but he is too stupid to succeed. His girlfriend tries to help him, but it seems he is too foolish to succeed.

Title: 336. Naughty Dallas
description: A small-town girl comes to Dallas to make it as a stripper.

Title: 337. Stage to Thunder Rock
description: An aging sheriff is put in the position of having to arrest the outlaw father and two sons with whom he was raised.

Title: 338. Male Companion
description: Antoine was raised into the easy life by his very rich grandfather. After the death of his grandfather the money has gone and Antoine falls under the influence of various easy people.

Title: 339. Primitive Love
description: "Doctor" Jayne Mansfield is in Italy to show a peer her documentary about mating customs from around the world while at the same time having to deal with two bellhops who have an idea or two about mating with Jayne.

Title: 340. Lola
description: Betrayed by his accomplices, Aris, the fastest knife in Troumba, reunites with his true love, Lola. Now, a mean cabaret owner wants him dead, and he must tie up all the loose ends. But, is there an easy way out from the port of lost souls?

Title: 341. The Luck of Ginger Coffey
description: An out-of-work Irish immigrant in Montreal remains hopeful that his luck is about to change but his disillusioned family grow tired of his pigheadedness and instability.

Title: 342. They All Died Laughing
description: An English professor decides that there are too many useless people in the world and invents a gas that will kill them off. But first they'll at least have a good laugh.

Title: 343. Wild and Wonderful
description: Cognac, a pampered poodle and popular star on French television, creates marital problems for his pretty owner Giselle when he becomes jealous of her new husband.

Title: 344. A Global Affair
description: A bachelor employee at the United Nations building takes care of an abandoned baby.

Title: 345. Go Kart Go
description: A group of youngsters have fun using their ingenuity to build their own go-kart - with the hope of eclipsing a rival children's gang, and beating them at the local race track.

Title: 346. Astro Boy: The Brave in space
description: The story of Astroboy, a robot created by Dr Elephant, in the image of a boy, who has super strength and could fly.
